New Records: Glenn Maxwell hit the fastest century in Cricket World Cup history with a 40-ball ton.
Bas de Leede's figures of 2-115 are the most expensive in ODI history.
Maxwell broke his own Australian record for fastest ODI century, previously set at the 2015 World Cup against Sri Lanka.
Key Match Events: Glenn Maxwell scored a century off just 40 balls despite being unwell.
Australia won the match by 309 runs, scoring 399-8 and bowling out the Netherlands for 90.
Maxwell hit nine fours and eight sixes in his innings.
Maxwell's innings began in the 39th over and he did not face a ball until the 41st over.
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Maxwell expressed that he did not expect much due to his illness but felt more relaxed when he went out to bat.
Maxwell mentioned that his innings gave him a huge confidence boost after recent struggles with form and injuries.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Maxwell had been suffering from illness and had a sleepless night before the match.
Maxwell's century was the fourth-quickest in ODI history, nine balls shy of AB de Villiers' record.
